Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in its analysis under section 97(1)(b)(ii) of IRPA regarding personalized risk
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' claims assessed for credibility; no evidence of continued threat found

Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Risk deemed generalized due to high crime rates in Mexico
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged error in assessing personalized risk
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No indication that relevant evidence was ignored
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Personalized risk not faced generally by others in country of origin
Crimes.Application_Factor: Past incidents without evidence of ongoing targeting

Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Analysis of personalized vs. generalized risk
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence showing continued pursuit by Los Zetas
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Claims not supported by sufficient evidence of ongoing threat
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board’s interpretation of personalized risk
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Not applicable — claim under protection provisions

Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible but limited to past events
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Plausible past harm, but no current threat established
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Generalized risk due to country conditions
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Initially targeted, but no evidence of continued interest

Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Federal Court review of administrative decision
